thread.title: Travel Disruption in China as Over 60 Flights Are Cancelled Including Air China, China Southern, Shenzhen Airlines, and More Affecting Routes to Xi'an, Hangzhou, Beijing, Chengdu, and More - New Update - Travel And Tour World
thread.title_full: Travel Disruption in China as Over 60 Flights Are Cancelled Including Air China, China Southern, Shenzhen Airlines, and More Affecting Routes to Xi'an, Hangzhou, Beijing, Chengdu, and More - New Update - Travel And Tour World

title: Travel Disruption in China as Over 60 Flights Are Cancelled Including Air China, China Southern, Shenzhen Airlines, and More Affecting Routes to Xi'an, Hangzhou, Beijing, Chengdu, and More - New Update - Travel And Tour World
text:
Recently, several airports in China have experienced a surge in flight cancellations, impacting thousands of passengers and causing widespread travel disruptions. A total of 60 cancellations have been reported across major airports, including Xi’an Xianyang, Hangzhou Xiaoshan, Kunming Changshui, Shenzhen Bao’an, Chengdu Shuangliu, Guangzhou Baiyun, Shanghai Hongqiao, and Beijing’s Capital and Daxing airports. Affected destinations include Fuzhou, Shenzhen, Beijing, Dalian, Chengdu, Guangzhou, Tianjin, Chongqing, Hangzhou, Xiamen, and more. Summary of Cancellations Airport Total Cancellations Affected Destinations Xi’an Xianyang International Airport (ZLXY) 5 Fuzhou, Shenzhen, Beijing, Dalian, Qamdo Hangzhou Xiaoshan International Airport (ZSHC) 5 Shenzhen, Guangzhou, Chengdu, Tianjin, Beijing Kunming Changshui International Airport (ZPPP) 5 Xishuangbanna, Dehong, Nanjing, Ningbo Shenzhen Bao’an International Airport (ZGSZ) 5 Zhengzhou, Beijing, Chengdu, Hangzhou Chengdu Shuangliu International Airport (ZUUU) 8 Beijing, Zhengzhou, Shenzhen, Qamdo Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport (ZGGG) 5 Chengdu, Dalian, Beijing, Hangzhou Shanghai Hongqiao International Airport (ZSSS) 7 Beijing, Chongqing, Xiamen, Dashuipo Beijing Daxing International Airport (ZBAD) 2 Dalian, Xiamen Beijing Capital International Airport (ZBAA) 18 Xi’an, Shanghai, Chengdu, Lanzhou, Chongqing, Guangzhou Impact on Passengers
These flight cancellations in China have caused significant disruption to travel plans. Passengers, especially those with tight itineraries or connecting flights, have faced delays or, in some cases, been stranded with few alternatives. With multiple cancellations affecting both domestic and international routes, passengers are often left scrambling for other available flights or rebooking options.
Xi’an Xianyang International Airport (ZLXY)
Xi’an Xianyang International Airport (ZLXY) has seen multiple cancellations across key routes, with flights to Fuzhou, Shenzhen, Beijing, and Dalian particularly impacted. Some of the notable cancellations include: Advertisement These Xi’an Xianyang flight cancellations have left many passengers with limited options for rebooking or alternative travel plans.
Hangzhou Xiaoshan International Airport (ZSHC) Advertisement Hangzhou Xiaoshan International Airport (ZSHC) also experienced a series of cancellations, affecting key routes to Shenzhen, Guangzhou, Chengdu, and Tianjin. Affected flights included: CCA1737 (A321) to Shenzhen Bao’an International (SZX) – cancelled on Thursday at 07:30 AM CST. CCA1795 (A321) to Guangzhou Baiyun International (CAN) – cancelled on Wednesday at 03:25 PM CST. CCA1757 (A319) to Chengdu Shuangliu International (CTU) – cancelled on Wednesday at 01:55 PM CST. CXA8229 (B738) to Tianjin Binhai International (TSN) – cancelled on Wednesday at 07:35 AM CST. CCA1701 (A320) to Beijing Capital International (PEK) – cancelled on Wednesday at 07:00 AM CST.
The Hangzhou Xiaoshan cancellations have caused significant issues for passengers, particularly those with international connections.
Kunming Changshui International Airport (ZPPP)
Kunming Changshui International Airport (ZPPP) also faced a number of cancellations. These primarily affected flights to Xishuangbanna, Dehong, Nanjing, and Ningbo. Some of the affected flights include: CES5905 (737) to Xishuangbanna Gasa (JHG) – cancelled on Friday at 08:30 PM CST and Wednesday at 08:30 PM CST. RLH6501 (B738) to Dehong Mangshi Airport (LUM) – cancelled on Wednesday at 11:00 PM CST. CES2766 (A20N) to Nanjing Lukou International (NKG) – cancelled on Wednesday at 05:20 PM CST. CSC8255 (A320) to Ningbo Lishe International (NGB) – cancelled on Wednesday at 04:25 PM CST.
These Kunming Changshui cancellations have particularly affected passengers traveling on regional routes, with fewer options for alternative travel.
Shenzhen Bao’an International Airport (ZGSZ)
Shenzhen Bao’an International Airport (ZGSZ) also faced significant cancellations, particularly to Zhengzhou, Beijing, Chengdu, and Hangzhou. Some of the key cancellations included: CHH7735 (B738) to Zhengzhou Xinzheng International (CGO) – cancelled on Thursday at 06:05 PM CST. CCA1314 (B773) to Beijing Capital International (PEK) – cancelled on Thursday at 04:00 PM CST. CCA4340 (A321) to Chengdu Shuangliu International (CTU) – cancelled on Thursday at 01:45 PM CST. CCA1376 (A330) to Beijing Capital International (PEK) – cancelled on Thursday at 01:30 PM CST. CCA1738 (A321) to Hangzhou Xiaoshan International (HGH) – cancelled on Thursday at 10:55 AM CST.
Shenzhen Bao’an airport delays have particularly impacted passengers on long-haul and domestic flights, leading to increased frustrations for travelers.
Chengdu Shuangliu International Airport (ZUUU)
Chengdu Shuangliu International Airport (ZUUU) faced widespread cancellations, particularly on flights to Beijing, Zhengzhou, Shenzhen, and Qamdo. Key cancellations include: CCA1426 (A333) to Beijing Capital International (PEK) – cancelled on Thursday at 10:00 PM CST. CCA4183 (A330) to Beijing Capital International (PEK) – cancelled on Thursday at 07:00 PM CST. CCA4049 (A320) to Zhengzhou Xinzheng International (CGO) – cancelled on Thursday at 04:15 PM CST. TBA9959 (A19N) to Qamdo Bangda (BPX) – cancelled on Thursday at 09:05 AM CST. CCA4407 (A319) to Qamdo Bangda (BPX) – cancelled on Thursday at 07:10 AM CST.
The Chengdu Shuangliu flight disruptions have caused major setbacks, especially for passengers traveling to international destinations.
Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport (ZGGG)
Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport (ZGGG) also experienced several cancellations, particularly on flights to Chengdu, Dalian, Beijing, and Hangzhou. These included: CSC8738 (A321) to Chengdu Shuangliu International (CTU) – cancelled on Thursday at 09:35 PM CST. CSN6458 (A20N) to Dalian Zhoushuizi International (DLC) – cancelled on Wednesday at 09:20 PM CST. CCA1302 (B773) to Beijing Capital International (PEK) – cancelled on Wednesday at 07:40 PM CST. CCA1796 (A321) to Hangzhou Xiaoshan International (HGH) – cancelled on Wednesday at 07:15 PM CST.
The impact of these cancellations, especially for domestic travelers, is considerable, particularly in regions like Guangdong.
Shanghai Hongqiao International Airport (ZSSS) and Beijing Daxing International Airport (ZBAD)
Both Shanghai Hongqiao International (ZSSS) and Beijing Daxing International (ZBAD) were also affected by cancellations. Flights from Shanghai included: CES5635 (A20N) to Xiamen Gaoqi International (XMN) – cancelled on Saturday at 07:55 AM CST. CCA1532 (B77W) to Beijing Capital International (PEK) – cancelled on Friday at 02:00 PM CST.
In Beijing Daxing International, the following flight was impacted: CCD8688 (B738) to Dalian Zhoushuizi International (DLC) – cancelled on Wednesday at 09:35 PM CST.
Conclusion: Widespread Flight Cancellations in China Take Their Toll
The recent surge in flight cancellations in China has had a significant impact on passengers, particularly those traveling to key destinations like Xi’an, Hangzhou, Shenzhen, Chengdu, and Beijing. As more cancellations continue to affect travel schedules, it raises concerns over the reliability of China’s aviation network, leaving passengers with fewer travel options and more uncertainty about their trips.
